page.title: 02Yeolmbridge
page.content: We visited the post-office/shop part of Werrington Park Estate the post box was marked GEORGE REGINA it is 50 year old.It was a mill 80 years ago all that is left is 4 grind stones showing dressing marks made by the mill owner, Mr.Pearn, his skill was not passed on after he died.There were 3 sets of stones and crusher the miller made his own cogs. The structure still exists, the water wheel once used the waters of the R.ATTERY,but no longer exists.About 70 people visit the shop each week,it sells no fresh foods except eggs,also newspapers.Outside is a bus stop on the only main road in this block,served by 3 bus companies,Jennings,Frys and L.C.H.They provide public and school transport.We went over the oldest bridge in Cornwall built in 1305.Mrs.Pearce had a cannon ball from the river.
